meanings.definition: To move or cause to move into a sloping position.
meanings.sent1: The bookshelf was tilting dangerously, so I propped it up with a block.
meanings.sent2: She was tilting her head to the side to listen carefully.
meanings.sent3: The tower of blocks was tilting like a wobbly jelly on a plate.
meanings.sent4: The tree branches were tilting towards the ground under the weight of the snow.
meanings.sent5: The boat was tilting so much that it felt like we were sliding off the deck.

meanings.definition: To lean or incline in a particular direction.
meanings.sent1: The old fence was tilting to the left due to strong winds.
meanings.sent2: She was tilting the mirror to get a better view of her outfit.
meanings.sent3: The tower of cards was tilting towards the window, threatening to collapse.
meanings.sent4: The sun was setting, tilting the sky into shades of pink and orange.
meanings.sent5: The flower was tilting towards the sunlight, seeking its warmth.

meanings.definition: To engage in a joust or tournament.
meanings.sent1: The knights were tilting with lances in the grand tournament.
meanings.sent2: He was tilting against his opponent in a fierce jousting match.
meanings.sent3: The tilting match ended with both knights falling off their horses comically.
meanings.sent4: The sound of tilting lances echoed through the arena, thrilling the spectators.
meanings.sent5: The crowd cheered as the champion knight prepared for another tilting round.
